``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting up Stimulus with Webpack Helpers DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to initialize a Stimulus application using Webpack helpers for controller autoloading. It imports required dependencies, starts the application, and loads controllers from a specified context directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/handbook/07_installing_stimulus.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { Application } from "@hotwired/stimulus" import { definitionsFromContext } from "@hotwired/stimulus-webpack-helpers" window.Stimulus = Application.start() const context = require.context("./controllers", true, /\.js$/) Stimulus.load(definitionsFromContext(context)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete Content Loader Controller with Timer Management DESCRIPTION: The complete implementation of the content loader controller with asynchronous HTML loading, automatic refreshing at specified intervals, and proper resource cleanup when disconnected. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/handbook/06_working_with_external_resources.md#2025-04-17_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // src/controllers/content_loader_controller.js import { Controller } from "@hotwired/stimulus" export default class extends Controller { static values = { url: String, refreshInterval: Number } connect() { this.load() if (this.hasRefreshIntervalValue) { this.startRefreshing() } } disconnect() { this.stopRefreshing() } load() { fetch(this.urlValue) .then(response => response.text()) .then(html => this.element.innerHTML = html) } startRefreshing() { this.refreshTimer = setInterval(() => { this.load() }, this.refreshIntervalValue) } stopRefreshing() { if (this.refreshTimer) { clearInterval(this.refreshTimer) } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining HTML Structure with Stimulus Attributes DESCRIPTION: HTML markup that demonstrates how to use Stimulus controller, target and action attributes to create interactive elements. This example sets up a greeting component with input, button, and output elements. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing connect() Lifecycle Callback in Stimulus Controller DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to implement the connect() lifecycle callback in a Stimulus controller. The connect() method is called whenever the controller is connected to the DOM. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/lifecycle_callbacks.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { Controller } from "@hotwired/stimulus" export default class extends Controller { connect() { // ‚Ä¶ } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Basic Stimulus Controller DESCRIPTION: Initial setup of a Stimulus controller class extending the base Controller. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/handbook/02_hello_stimulus.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // src/controllers/hello_controller.js import { Controller } from "@hotwired/stimulus" export default class extends Controller { } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Event Shorthand Notation for Button Click DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use the shorthand notation for common element/event pairs, where the event name can be omitted for certain elements like buttons where click is the default event. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/actions.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enhanced Slideshow Controller with Values DESCRIPTION: Improved version of the slideshow controller using Stimulus values for state management with DOM persistence. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/handbook/05_managing_state.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { Controller } from "@hotwired/stimulus" export default class extends Controller { static targets = [ "slide" ] static values = { index: Number } next() { this.indexValue++ } previous() { this.indexValue-- } indexValueChanged() { this.showCurrentSlide() } showCurrentSlide() { this.slideTargets.forEach((element, index) => { element.hidden = index !== this.indexValue }) } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Stimulus Controller for Greeting Functionality DESCRIPTION: JavaScript implementation of a Stimulus controller that interacts with the HTML structure above. This controller defines name and output targets and implements a greet method that updates the output with a personalized greeting. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // hello_controller.js import { Controller } from "@hotwired/stimulus" export default class extends Controller { static targets = [ "name", "output" ] greet() { this.outputTarget.textContent = `Hello, ${this.nameTarget.value}!` } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining CSS Classes in a Stimulus Controller DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code showing how to define CSS classes by logical name in a Stimulus controller using the static classes array. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/css_classes.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` // controllers/search_controller.js import { Controller } from "@hotwired/stimulus" export default class extends Controller { static classes = [ "loading" ] // ‚Ä¶ } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Dispatching Events from a Stimulus Controller DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to use the `dispatch` method to emit custom events from a Stimulus controller. The example shows a ClipboardController dispatching a 'copy' event with the content of a text input field. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/controllers.md#2025-04-17_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` class ClipboardController extends Controller { static targets = [ "source" ] copy() { this.dispatch("copy", { detail: { content: this.sourceTarget.value } }) navigator.clipboard.writeText(this.sourceTarget.value) } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Clipboard Copy Functionality in Stimulus Controller DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript code implements the copy method in the Stimulus controller to copy text from the source target to the clipboard. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/handbook/03_building_something_real.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` copy() { navigator.clipboard.writeText(this.sourceTarget.value) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Value Change Callback with Previous Value DESCRIPTION: Implementation of a change callback that includes access to both current and previous values. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/values.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` export default class extends Controller { static values = { url: String } urlValueChanged(value, previousValue) { /* ‚Ä¶ */ } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Receiving Events in a Stimulus Controller DESCRIPTION: Example of how to receive and process dispatched events in another controller. The EffectsController's flash method extracts the content from the event detail object using destructuring. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/controllers.md#2025-04-17_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` class EffectsController extends Controller { flash({ detail: { content } }) { console.log(content) // 1234 } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing a Clipboard Copy Feature with Stimulus in HTML DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to implement a clipboard copy feature using Stimulus. It shows the HTML structure with data attributes that connect to a Stimulus controller. The example includes a source input field containing the text to be copied and a button that triggers the copy action. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/handbook/00_the_origin_of_stimulus.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Preventing Controller Registration with shouldLoad DESCRIPTION: Shows how to conditionally prevent a controller from loading based on environmental factors by overriding the static shouldLoad method. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/controllers.md#2025-04-17_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` class UnloadableController extends ApplicationController { static get shouldLoad() { return false } } // This controller will not be loaded application.register("unloadable", UnloadableController) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Target Attributes in HTML for Stimulus Controller DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to define target attributes in HTML for a Stimulus controller. It shows the usage of data-controller and data-search-target attributes. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/targets.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Content Loader Controller Implementation DESCRIPTION: Initial implementation of a Stimulus controller that fetches HTML from a URL and injects it into the controller's element. Uses the connect lifecycle method to trigger loading when the controller initializes. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/handbook/06_working_with_external_resources.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // src/controllers/content_loader_controller.js import { Controller } from "@hotwired/stimulus" export default class extends Controller { static values = { url: String } connect() { this.load() } load() { fetch(this.urlValue) .then(response => response.text()) .then(html => this.element.innerHTML = html) } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Registering Negated Custom Action Options DESCRIPTION: Shows how to register custom action options that respond to negated values (prefixed with !), allowing for conditional event routing based on toggle state. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/actions.md#2025-04-17_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` import { Application } from "@hotwired/stimulus" const application = Application.start() application.registerActionOption("open", ({ event, value }) => { if (event.type == "toggle") { return event.target.open == value } else { return true } }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Controller Element Type with TypeScript in Stimulus DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to override the default Element type for a controller by using TypeScript generics. This example shows specifying HTMLFormElement as the controller element type, which enables proper type checking for form-related operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/using_typescript.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { Controller } from "@hotwired/stimulus" export default class MyController extends Controller { submit() { new FormData(this.element) } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Refactored Stimulus Controller with Getter DESCRIPTION: Final controller implementation with a getter method for cleaner code organization. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/handbook/02_hello_stimulus.md#2025-04-17_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // src/controllers/hello_controller.js import { Controller } from "@hotwired/stimulus" export default class extends Controller { static targets = [ "name" ] greet() { console.log(`Hello, ${this.name}!`) } get name() { return this.nameTarget.value } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML with CSS Class Attributes for Stimulus Controller DESCRIPTION: Example of HTML implementing CSS class attributes using the data-[controller]-[logical-name]-class format. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/css_classes.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Value Properties with TypeScript in Stimulus DESCRIPTION: Shows how to define the types for Stimulus value properties using the TypeScript 'declare' keyword. This ensures type checking for value properties while avoiding overriding the existing Stimulus property implementation. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/using_typescript.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: typescript CODE: ``` import { Controller } from "@hotwired/stimulus" export default class MyController extends Controller { static values = { code: String } declare codeValue: string declare readonly hasCodeValue: boolean } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Multiple Value Type Definitions in Stimulus DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to define multiple values of different types (String, Number, Object) in a Stimulus controller. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/values.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` export default class extends Controller { static values = { url: String, interval: Number, params: Object } // ‚Ä¶ } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding class to button element for conditional display (HTML) DESCRIPTION: HTML markup adding a CSS class to a button that will be conditionally displayed based on clipboard API support. This class will be targeted by CSS to control visibility. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/handbook/06_working_with_external_resources.md#2025-04-17_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` disconnect() { this.stopRefreshing() } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Target Names in Stimulus Controller Class DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript snippet shows how to define target names in a Stimulus controller class using the static targets array. It sets up targets for query, errorMessage, and results. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/targets.md#2025-04-17_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // controllers/search_controller.js import { Controller } from "@hotwired/stimulus" export default class extends Controller { static targets = [ "query", "errorMessage", "results" ] // ‚Ä¶ } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Avoiding Event-Based Action Names in Stimulus.js HTML DESCRIPTION: An example of a naming convention to avoid when creating Stimulus.js actions. This approach simply repeats the event name, making it less descriptive of the actual behavior. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/handbook/02_hello_stimulus.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // src/controllers/hello_controller.js import { Controller } from "@hotwired/stimulus" export default class extends Controller { greet() { console.log("Hello, Stimulus!", this.element) } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Cancellable Events in Stimulus DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to make dispatched events cancellable, allowing other controllers to prevent default behavior. The example shows a ClipboardController that checks if its event was prevented before proceeding. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/controllers.md#2025-04-17_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` class ClipboardController extends Controller { static targets = [ "source" ] copy() { const event = this.dispatch("copy", { cancelable: true }) if (event.defaultPrevented) return navigator.clipboard.writeText(this.sourceTarget.value) } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating HTML Structure for Slideshow Controller DESCRIPTION: HTML markup defining a slideshow with navigation buttons and slide elements using Stimulus data attributes for controller binding, actions, and targets. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Custom Error Handling for Stimulus DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to override Stimulus' default error handling by implementing a custom handleError method. It includes logging a warning message and sending the error to a tracking system. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/handbook/07_installing_stimulus.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // src/application.js import { Application } from "@hotwired/stimulus" window.Stimulus = Application.start() Stimulus.handleError = (error, message, detail) => { console.warn(message, detail) ErrorTrackingSystem.captureException(error) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Value Change Callback Implementation DESCRIPTION: Example of implementing a change callback method for a value in a Stimulus controller. Shows how to respond to value changes. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/values.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` export default class extends Controller { static values = { url: String } urlValueChanged() { fetch(this.urlValue).then(/* ‚Ä¶ */) } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Handling Optional Targets in Stimulus Controller DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript code demonstrates how to handle optional targets in a Stimulus controller. It checks for the existence of a 'results' target before attempting to use it. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/targets.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` if (this.hasResultsTarget) { this.resultsTarget.innerHTML = "‚Ä¶" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Invoking Functions on Outlet Controllers DESCRIPTION: These code snippets demonstrate invoking functions defined in outlet controllers. The chat controller accesses and calls methods on each connected user-status outlet controller. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/outlets.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` // user_status_controller.js export default class extends Controller { markAsSelected(event) { // ... } } ``` LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` // chat_controller.js export default class extends Controller { static outlets = [ "user-status" ] selectAll(event) { this.userStatusOutlets.forEach(status => status.markAsSelected(event)) } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML Example for Window-Level Event Listening DESCRIPTION: Shows how to listen for events at the window level when the receiving controller is not a parent of the emitting controller. This allows communication between controllers in different DOM branches. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/controllers.md#2025-04-17_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Target Callbacks in Stimulus Controller DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript snippet shows how to implement target element callbacks in a Stimulus controller. It defines methods for when item targets are connected or disconnected. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/targets.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` export default class extends Controller { static targets = [ "item" ] itemTargetConnected(element) { this.sortElements(this.itemTargets) } itemTargetDisconnected(element) { this.sortElements(this.itemTargets) } // Private sortElements(itemTargets) { /* ... */ } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Action Parameters in Stimulus.js Controllers DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to access parameters in controller actions. The example shows that parameters are only passed to the controller specified in the parameter attribute prefix, with automatic type casting for different data types. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/actions.md#2025-04-17_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // ItemController upvote(event) { // { id: 12345, url: "/votes", active: true, payload: { value: 1234567 } } console.log(event.params) } // SpinnerController start(event) { // {} console.log(event.params) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding data attributes for progressive enhancement in HTML (Stimulus) DESCRIPTION: HTML markup showing how to add data attributes to enable progressive enhancement in a Stimulus controller. The data-clipboard-supported-class attribute will be used to show the button only when clipboard functionality is supported. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/handbook/04_designing_for_resilience.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updated Connect Method with Conditional Refresh DESCRIPTION: Enhanced connect method that loads content immediately and conditionally starts the refresh timer if a refresh interval value has been provided in the HTML. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/handbook/06_working_with_external_resources.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` connect() { this.load() if (this.hasRefreshIntervalValue) { this.startRefreshing() } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Feature detection for clipboard API in Stimulus controller (JavaScript) DESCRIPTION: JavaScript implementation of the connect() lifecycle method in a Stimulus controller that tests for clipboard API support and conditionally adds a CSS class to show the copy button only when supported. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/handbook/04_designing_for_resilience.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` connect() { if ("clipboard" in navigator) { this.element.classList.add(this.supportedClass); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Default Values in Stimulus Controller DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to define default values for controller properties using the expanded type and default syntax. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/values.md#2025-04-17_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` export default class extends Controller { static values = { url: { type: String, default: '/bill' }, interval: { type: Number, default: 5 }, clicked: Boolean } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining HTML Data Attributes for Stimulus Controller DESCRIPTION: Example of setting up a data attribute value on a Stimulus controller element. Shows how to properly structure the data-controller and value attributes. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/values.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Destructuring Parameters Object in Stimulus.js Actions DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use JavaScript destructuring to directly access the params object without needing the entire event object, simplifying the controller action method signature. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/actions.md#2025-04-17_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` upvote({ params }) { // { id: 12345, url: "/votes", active: true, payload: { value: 1234567 } } console.log(params) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Stimulus Controller with Value Definition DESCRIPTION: Basic implementation of a Stimulus controller that defines a URL value and uses it in a fetch request. Demonstrates value definition and usage. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/values.md#2025-04-17_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // controllers/loader_controller.js import { Controller } from "@hotwired/stimulus" export default class extends Controller { static values = { url: String } connect() { fetch(this.urlValue).then(/* ‚Ä¶ */) } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing HTML Structure for Copy to Clipboard Functionality DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet sets up the basic structure for a PIN display with a copy button, including data attributes for Stimulus integration. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/handbook/03_building_something_real.md#2025-04-17_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Overriding Stimulus Default Attributes DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to override Stimulus' default data attributes when they conflict with other libraries. It creates a custom schema that modifies the default action attribute while preserving other defaults. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/handbook/07_installing_stimulus.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // src/application.js import { Application, defaultSchema } from "@hotwired/stimulus" const customSchema = { ...defaultSchema, actionAttribute: 'data-stimulus-action' } window.Stimulus = Application.start(document.documentElement, customSchema); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing and Using Nested Outlet Controllers DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript example demonstrates how to properly reference nested Stimulus controller outlets by removing namespace delimiters in the property name. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/outlets.md#2025-04-17_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: js CODE: ``` // chat_controller.js export default class extends Controller { static outlets = [ "admin--user-status" ] selectAll(event) { // returns undefined this.admin__UserStatusOutlets // returns controller reference this.adminUserStatusOutlets } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listening for Global Window Events DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to listen for events on the global window object by appending @window to the event name in the action descriptor. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/actions.md#2025-04-17_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```

SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/handbook/06_working_with_external_resources.md#2025-04-17_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` startRefreshing() { this.refreshTimer = setInterval(() => { this.load() }, this.refreshIntervalValue) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Outlet HTML Attribute Example DESCRIPTION: A simple HTML example showing how to connect a chat controller to user-status elements as outlets using a CSS class selector. SOURCE: https://github.com/hotwired/stimulus/blob/main/docs/reference/controllers.md#2025-04-17_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Outlets in a Stimulus Controller DESCRIPTION: This JavaScript code shows how to define outlets in a Stimulus controller class.
